column4: can some of the server wizards here relate where to add commands that you want to start up when the server is rebooted?
nginx should start with the system
i set it up with passenger, so it doesn't autostart
there must be a startup file somewhere?
where i can just insert one line or other lines?
but you have a init.d file for it? just do « sudo update-rc.d nginx defaults »
call it from /etc/rc.local ? make an init script? it depends on what type of stuff
is rc.local just a list of commands that will be called upon startup?
yes is a bash script so it can be more complex than just a list of commands
but it can be just that of course
